AboutMe.description:
Hello, my name is Jiho Ryuu. I was born and raised in Chiba, Japan, to Chinese parents. I moved to Kyoto when I entered university.

One of my hobbies is traveling. My dream is to someday travel all across Japan and the world. I believe that experiencing new landscapes and cultures helps me grow as a person.

I am currently a student majoring in CS at Kyoto University. I belong to the Taniguchi Lab, where I have researched multimodal AI. In my pre-research, I worked on developing AI systems that combine images and text. I also studied abroad in Arizona, USA, for a year, where I continued studying computer science.

Now, I am aiming to become a full-stack engineer with expertise in AI research. I am actively learning a wide range of technologies, focusing mainly on backend but also exploring frontend and infrastructure. Creating products that help people and make the world a better place brings me the most joy. For that reason, I continue to study and challenge myself in various technical fields.

Education.intro: I enrolled in university in April 2021 and, after completing a one-year study abroad program, I am scheduled to graduate in March 2026. I plan to pursue graduate studies and graduate in March 2028. You can click the icons to visit the university websites.

edu1.name: Kyoto University, CS
edu1.description: I am currently a fourth-year undergraduate student. In addition to basic subjects such as mathematics and physics, I have studied a wide range of fields including computer science, graph theory, algorithms, and artificial intelligence.

edu2.name: Arizona State University
edu2.description: During my fourth year of undergraduate studies, I studied abroad for one year at Arizona State University, majoring in Computer Science. Attending classes with local students was a great experience. Arizona State University is one of the top universities in the U.S. in terms of accepting international students. I had the opportunity to interact with people from countries I rarely meet in Japan, including the U.S., Mexico, Spain, Saudi Arabia, Pakistan, Thailand, Italy and Germany.

Experience.intro:
This section shows my internship experience. I plan to continue gaining experience through both long-term and short-term internships.
You can click the icons to visit the company's website.

exp1.name: muilab Inc.
exp1.description: Although this was originally planned to be a long-term internship, I had to pause due to my study abroad. I mainly worked on infrastructure using AWS and wrote test cases in TypeScript.

exp2.name: StarUp Inc.
exp2.description: I am currently working as a long-term intern. I am involved mainly in AI development and backend infrastructure. I also serve as a project manager for a drawing management service product.

Skills.intro: I mainly focus on backend development, but I'm also exploring frontend and cloud technologies.

Products.intro: These are the products and projects I’ve been involved in. I will continue to update them in the future.

items.name: product1
items.detail: I used transfer learning on the deep learning-based object detection algorithm YOLO (You Only Look Once) with self-annotated data. Using a tool called labelImg, I annotated the data and then used Google Colab to fine-tune a pretrained model. Since preprocessing was crucial during annotation, I used OpenCV for tasks like resolution adjustment and masking. I also created a custom script to validate multiple images. (Validation results are not shown here due to copyright issues.) The trained model is currently used in Archaive, a drawing management system, to detect components in technical drawings.
items.title: Drawing Detection AI

items.name: product2
items.detail: I worked on implementing the drawing management system 'Archaive' at StarUp. Archaive is a database for managing technical drawings and supports similar drawing search via AI. I primarily worked on the backend, implementing CRUD operations for the database, creating API endpoints, developing new features, and also served as a PM and full-stack engineer.
items.title: Archaive

items.name: product3
items.detail: As part of my research, I built a Variational Autoencoder (VAE), a type of unsupervised learning technique using neural networks. I used the MNIST dataset for training.
items.title: Variational Autoencoder

items.name: product4
items.detail: This is the website you’re currently viewing. I built it from scratch to introduce myself and showcase my skills. From design to implementation, I handled everything on my own.
items.title: Portfolio

items.name: product5
items.detail: This is a feature used in the contact form of this portfolio. When you submit a message, it gets sent directly to my Slack workspace.
items.title: Slack Notification

items.name: product6
items.detail: I contributed to the development of a handwritten kanji recognition model for mobile apps. Using EfficientNet—a lightweight deep learning model suitable for smartphones—we analyzed stroke data and improved image-based recognition through fine-tuning.
items.title: Kanji Recognition

Contacts.title: Contacts
Contacts.intro:
Thank you for visiting my site. I hope you got to know a little about me through this page.
If you have any comments or feedback, please feel free to contact me using the form below.
